title: State & Exp
message:
A statement produces a behavior and a side effect

Expressions produce values and is identified by anything the interpreter must evaluate
They produce a value and can be placed where a value is expected

Constant expressions are a value that is determined during compilation they cannot be changed
If you don't have to calculate anything in your head it is a constant expression

An Expression Statement is an expression with a side effect ex. var x = 5 +5; where 5+5 is the expression but since it's been assigned to x the side effect is that x is now 10
